definition:
A module $M$ is [*artinian*]{} if it satisfies the following equivalent
conditions:

-   the descending chain condition holds for submodules of $M$;

-   every nonempty family of submodules of $M$ has a minimal element.

A ring $R$ is [*left artinian*]{} if it is artinian as a left module
over itself (i.e. if $_RR$ is an artinian module), and [*right
artinian*]{} if it is artinian as a right module over itself (i.e. if
$R_R$ is an artinian module), and simply [*artinian*]{} if both
conditions hold.
